page.title: 01SCOUTING IN GUERNSEY
page.content: Scouting is a world wide organisation with over 17 million members. Here in the Bailiwick of Guernsey we have 13 Scout Groups in various parts of the Island, with approximately 1000 Scouts and 134 leaders. Scouting is led in the Island by the Bailiwick Commissioner, who is appointed by the Chief Scout. We have a very fine Island Band and good archery facilities.The sea scouts have over 50 boats to call on and the air scouts have the cockpit of a Monitor jet at their Island H.Q. The Island Scouts are very lucky to own a very fine H.Q. in the Vale which has 50 vergees of land,and a farmhouse hostel with residential facilities.
